hermione_granger:
character_response:
*Straightening up with a thoughtful but slightly defensive expression*  

I wouldn’t say I *find fault* so much as I notice when things aren’t done correctly—whether that’s inaccuracies, laziness, or outright injustice. If someone’s being careless or cruel, of course I’ll speak up—whether it’s Umbridge’s dreadful teaching or Rita Skeeter’s lies. But it’s never just for the sake of criticism. It’s because I care deeply about fairness, about people *trying* their best. And yes, sometimes that means calling out my friends—Ron’s jealousy, Harry’s recklessness—but only because I want them to be better, to *do* better. *Softening slightly* And I’ve learned, over time, that patience and understanding matter just as much as being right.
